sourceMeaningMnemonic: Take the <radical>moon</radical> and <radical>wrap</radical> it in a bag and it will look just like a <kanji>cell</kanji>. It's a circle in a bigger circle. The moon is the nucleus. Yes! Science is happening!
meaningInfo: Picture the moon with a big bag circling it. Now look down at your biology homework on cells. They're identical!
readingMnemonic: As you learn about <kanji>cell</kanji>s you realize they're all over your <reading>ho</reading>me (<ja>ほう</ja>). Without ever noticing it, your home has been slowly filling with dead skin cells. And now that you know what they look like (the moon with a plastic wrap bag around it) you can see them everywhere.
readingInfo: AHHH CLEAN ALL OF THESE CELLS OUT OF YOUR HOME!
